message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! I think you'll really love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $180.
I'm really interested in the product, but $180 is a bit out of my budget. I was thinking more along the lines of $140. Would you be willing to meet me in the middle?

I understand you're looking to save some money, Bob. However, I've already made a significant concession by offering it to you for $180 initially. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make up for the initial discount. I'm now willing to sell it to you for $160.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I was thinking more along the lines of $145. Would you be willing to sell it to me for that price?

I'm starting to think we're getting close, Bob. However, I still need to make a profit on this sale. I'm willing to compromise, but I need to get at least $155 out of this deal. I'm now willing to sell it to you for $155.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to sell it to me for $150?

I think we're getting close, Bob, but I'm not willing to sell it to you for $150. I'm willing to meet you at the midpoint of the last two offers, which is $152.50. I'm now willing to sell it to you for $152.50.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me in the middle, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to sell it to me for $148?

I'm not willing to go below $152.50, Bob. That's the lowest I can go. I'm still willing to sell it to you for $152.50. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
I understand you're not willing to go below $152.50, but I'm still trying to make a deal. I'm willing to meet you at $145. If this is still not acceptable, I'll have to consider other options.
